Quiz.question: A class ____.
Quiz.option: is a blueprint from many objects
represents a specific real-world object
will hold specific values in its fields
specifies the type of a method

Quiz.question: In Java, a class specification ____.
Quiz.option: creates objects
requires the keyword new
creates references
none of the above

Quiz.question: True/False: The base 2 logarithm of 100 is 2
Quiz.option: True
False

Quiz.question: True/False: When you delete an item from an unordered array, in most cases you shift other items to fill in gap.
Quiz.option: True
False

Quiz.question: Big O notation tells
Quiz.option: how the speed of an algorithm relates to the number of items.
the running time of an algorithm for a given size data structure.
the running time of an algorithm for a given number of items.
how the size of a data structure relates to the number of items.

Quiz.question: The maximum number of elements that must be examined to complete a binary search in an array of 200 element is
In the selection sort,
Quiz.option: the largest keys accumulate on the left(low indices)
a minimum key is repeatedly discovered.
a number of items must be shifted to insert each item in its correctly sorted position.
the sorted items accumulated on the right

Quiz.question: True/False: The bubble sort always ends up comparing every item with every other item.
Quiz.option: True
False

Quiz.question: Computer sorting algorithms are more limited than humans in that
Quiz.option: humans are better at inventing new algorithms
computers can handle only a fixed amount of data
humans know what to sort, whereas computers need to be told
computers can compare only two things at a time.

Quiz.question: True/False: If there are N items, the bubble sort makes exactly N*N comparisons.
Quiz.option: True
False
